summary: This is an email from a US Attorney's Office (likely SDNY) staff member, likely Laura Birger, outlining the upcoming week's schedule. It mentions a court conference for Michael Avenatti, a moot court for Rob, a DAG visit, and a meeting with an attorney for an unnamed individual (possibly Ghislaine Maxwell). The document shows internal DOJ coordination on multiple cases.

persons.name: Laura Birger
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the original email to which this is a reply, identified by her email signature 'Birger, Laura (USANYS)'.

persons.name: Avenatti
persons.context: Subject of a court conference before Judge Gardephe; this is noted as his first appearance since his arrest. Likely refers to Michael Avenatti.

persons.name: Judge Gardephe
persons.context: Presiding over the Avenatti case conference, expected to set a trial date.

persons.name: Rob
persons.context: Subject of a rescheduled moot court for an opening statement, presumably in preparation for a trial.

persons.name: DAG
persons.context: A visit from the Deputy Attorney General is scheduled, with presentations from 'PC' (possibly the Public Corruption unit).

persons.name: GEP
persons.context: Referenced in relation to presentations and that 'some GEP things are in flux given recent developments.' Likely an acronym for Ghislaine Epstein or Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: AOC
persons.context: Mentioned alongside GEP for presentations to the DAG; acronym meaning is unclear from context.

connections.description: Judge Gardephe is presiding over Avenatti's court conference and will set his trial date.
Birger is part of the US Attorney's Office coordinating schedules and updates related to the GEP case.

events.title: Avenatti Court Conference
events.description: Conference in the Avenatti case before Judge Gardephe, noted as Avenatti's first appearance since his arrest. Expected to set a January 27 trial date.

events.title: Rob Moot Court
events.description: Rescheduled moot court practice for Rob's opening statement.

events.title: DAG Visit and GEP/AOC Presentations
events.description: Visit from the Deputy Attorney General with presentations from the GEP and AOC teams.

events.title: Meeting with Attorney
events.description: Meeting scheduled with an unnamed individual's attorney at 3:30 PM.

keyFacts: The email is internal DOJ correspondence from January 2020, showing scheduling for multiple cases including Avenatti and 'GEP' (likely Ghislaine Maxwell/Jeffrey Epstein).
It notes that 'some GEP things are in flux given recent developments,' indicating ongoing activity in the Epstein/Maxwell case following Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
The schedule includes a court conference for Michael Avenatti, who was facing federal charges at the time.
A visit from the Deputy Attorney General (DAG) is planned with presentations on GEP and AOC matters, showing high-level DOJ attention.
A meeting with an unnamed individual's attorney is scheduled, potentially related to the GEP case.
